@description.name: @description
@description.body: Base class for all unit tests.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This event can be fired by assertion functions instead of throwing a {@link qx.core.AssertionError}, ensuring that any code defined after the assertion call will still run. Event data: The {@link qx.core.AssertionError}

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The TestResult instance that runs the test

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The test currently running

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The owning object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: {String} The ID of the object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether If debugging code is enabled. (i.e. the setting qx.debug has the value on.)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if qx.debug set used by this.require["debug"]

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Instruct the test to wait. Used for asynchronous tests.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: delay {Integer?5000} Amount of time in milliseconds to wait.
@param.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to wait.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
deferredFunction {Function?false} Optional function to run after
 timeout has expired.
@param.description:
Optional function to run after
 timeout has expired.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {Object?window} Optional execution context for
 deferredFunction
@param.description:
Optional execution context for
 deferredFunction

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cancel a timeout started with wait() and run the given function. Used for asynchronous tests, e.g. in a listener's callback function. Important The used deferredFunction is the last function which is executed before the whole test case is disposed. But you are able to use a new wait() / resume() pair in the call sequence of the deferred function.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: deferredFunction {Function?} Function to run
@param.description: Function to run

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
 callback. By default the test instance is used.
@param.description:
reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
 callback. By default the test instance is used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the deferred function
@return.description: The return value of the deferred function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cancel a timeout started with wait() in setUp() and run the test function. Used for asynchronous setUp of tests.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the testRun
@return.description: The return value of the testRun

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Cancel a timeout started with wait() and return a function, which calls {@link #resume}. This function is useful to wrap an event handler or callback function within the resume call sequence. It provides the deferred function with all parameters from original caller.

 obj.addListener("appear", this.resumeHandler(function(e){

 }));
 this.wait();

@param.name: @param
@param.body: deferredFunction {Function} Function to run as event handler or callback
@param.description: Function to run as event handler or callback

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
self {Object?} reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
        callback. By default the test instance is used.
@param.description:
reference to the ‘this’ variable inside the
        callback. By default the test instance is used.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Function} Wrapper function which runs resume with deferred function
@return.description: Wrapper function which runs resume with deferred function

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Skip this test. Any code after a call to this method will not be executed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String|null} Optional message (reason why the test was skipped)
@param.description: Optional message (reason why the test was skipped)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an object to the auto dispose list. This can be cleared manually or will be flushed when the test case is disposed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: obj {qx.core.Object} Object to be automatically disposed.
@param.description: Object to be automatically disposed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Dispose all objects that got registered for auto disposal.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Assert that the condition evaluates to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: condition {var} Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.
@param.description: Condition to check for. Must evaluate to true.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: msg {String?} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@description.name: @description

@param.body: msg {String} Message to be shown if the assertion fails.
@param.description: Message to be shown if the assertion fails.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: compact {Boolean?false} Show less verbose message. Default: false.
@param.description: Show less verbose message. Default: false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.
